sn12.39:1.2: “Mendicants, what you intend or plan, and what you have underlying tendencies for become a support for the continuation of consciousness.
sn12.39:1.3: When this support exists, consciousness becomes established.
sn12.39:1.4: When consciousness is established, name and form are conceived.
sn12.39:1.5: Name and form are conditions for the six sense fields.
sn12.39:1.6: The six sense fields are conditions for contact.
sn12.39:1.7: Contact is a condition for feeling. …
sn12.39:1.13: sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress come to be.
sn12.39:1.14: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.39:2.1: If you don’t intend or plan, but still have underlying tendencies, this becomes a support for the continuation of consciousness.
sn12.39:2.2: When this support exists, consciousness becomes established.
sn12.39:2.3: When consciousness is established, name and form are conceived.
sn12.39:2.4: Name and form are conditions for the six sense fields. …
sn12.39:2.5: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.39:3.1: If you don’t intend or plan or have underlying tendencies, this doesn’t become a support for the continuation of consciousness.
sn12.39:3.2: With no support, consciousness is not established.
sn12.39:3.3: When consciousness is not established, name and form are not conceived.
sn12.39:3.4: When name and form cease, the six sense fields cease. …
sn12.39:3.5: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.”
